args: Their mission clear, Lea and the prince\ncontinue searching for the ebon fiend.
After a number of false starts, their investigation\nfinally begins to bear fruit...
This is the location where all the strange\nfiends have supposedly been sighted.
Which means we may learn something\nabout the ebon fiend here as well.\nWait, are those...?
Blast! Imperial soldiers! What are they\ndoing all the way out here?
Nothing good, I expect. Let us follow them.
Huh. I wouldn't have thought we'd find\na cave here. ...Er, but what is THAT?
It appears to be a magical sigil with\na lump of fiendflesh in the center.
Preparations for the ritual are complete!
Excellent! Then let us begin...\nFiend of ebon blackened hue,\nfrom this flesh you rise anew!

Blast and blast again! A total failure!
Oh, the physical form is similar enough,
but the power is nothing when compared
to the original.
Well, I guess we'll just have to try again.\n...Come with me, fiend! I'll let some other\nunit figure out what to do with you.
What is the meaning of this?!
It's the traitorous prince and that\nfiend-hating rebel!
I would have thought the pair of you\ntoo honorable for base eavesdropping.
Surely you're not so dense that you\ncannot see our plan for yourself?
We perform the ultimate experiment—\nwe seek nothing less than a perfect\ncopy of the ebon fiend itself!
Ordinarily, no—but we have a special\ningredient that makes the impossible real!
Behold, a lump of the ebon fiend's flesh!\nWith this, I will most certainly find a way\nto return it to the world once more!
Why, it is a gift from your father!
During the battle between your father and\nthe ebon fiend, he managed to hack off a\nrather substantial chunk of its flesh.
It was soon found to contain startling\nregenerative properties. Fearing it might\nbe used for ill, the kingdom hid it away.
And you just decided to come along\nand take it for yourselves?
Precisely! But alas, all we've managed\nto create thus far are pale imitations.
So that's where the rumors of the\nebon fiend are coming from...
The ebon fiend is arguably the most deadly\nof all fiends—and your father was likely\nthe only one capable of wounding it.
So now you see why I say our grand\nexperiment is a gift from him!
Furthermore, we've pressed the copies into\nservice with units throughout the Empire.

While they pale in comparison to the
beast they're modeled on, they're still
much stronger than the average fiend—
and no doubt serving us well as we speak!
Our nation owes your father a great debt\nindeed, young lady! Aaaah ha ha ha!
This is not what my father fought for!
He didn't give his life for the likes of YOU!
She's mad, this one! We've got her\ntotally outnumbered!
Take care of these fools, men!
Hang on, Lea! We'll never win here\nif we don't both work together!
Your tongues sully my father's good name,\nand I will see them removed myself!
Nnngh... N-no, I'm okay. But we have to\nstart working together if we want to get\nout of this in one piece!
Eeeek! I surrender! I surrendeeeeer!\nI'll do whatever you say!
I am not fit to call myself a knight after\nsurrendering to anger as I did.
I'm not sure I could have remained calm\nif I was in your place, Lea.
Anyway, let's get this back to the castle.\nI'm hoping Midgardsormr may be able to\ntell us more about the magical sigil.
With the Windwyrm's assistance, the prince sealed\naway the ebon fiend's flesh.
I find myself thinking on the past.
The day my father died, he had been\nhelping me with my sword training.
He promised to do more when he returned,\nbut of course, that never happened.
I sometimes catch myself thinking about\nhow we might yet be together now if he\nhad not battled that monster.
Still, he gave his life that others might\nyet live. As the daughter of a knight,\nI was able to accept that.
But now his actions have given birth\nto new conflict.
So what does his sacrifice mean now?
Why did he have to die?
Your father's sacrifice means just\nas much as it did on that day, Lea.
I want to believe that. Truly I do.
His death must have some purpose.\nIt must have made SOME impact\nin the world.
...Enough. So long as the Empire has\nother versions of the ebon fiend wandering\nabout, I do not have the luxury of pity.
I shall be ready for action tomorrow,\nYour Highness. And...thank you.
I will not let things end like this.
